body_html:
Okay.
Personally, I don't think that will offer enough flexibility. What if you need to implement Faster R-CNN style alternative training schedules, where you first train only the RPN and then the classifier Head.
If you use e.g. a LoggingTensorHook in this setting and tell it to log Tensors both from RPN and the Head, then you will produce an error while training only RPN for the first time as Tensors in the Head cannot be evaluated yet.
Wrapping all this in the run_step_fn would be super convoluted and ugly.
I guess you can say, that for such more complex problems one just should not use hooks at all ...
